title: Automatically infer `vector_size` when not set explicitly by the user

labels.name: easy
labels.description: Easy to fix or add, good for first time contributors

body:
We already have this info in the error message that prints out:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "ludwig/api.py", line 1393, in preprocess
    preprocessed_data = preprocess_for_training(
  File "ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1632, in preprocess_for_training
    processed = data_format_processor.preprocess_for_training(
  File "ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 240, in preprocess_for_training
    return _preprocess_df_for_training(
  File "ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1835, in _preprocess_df_for_training
    data, training_set_metadata = build_dataset(
  File "ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1183, in build_dataset
    proc_cols = build_data(dataset_cols, feature_configs, metadata, backend, skip_save_processed_input)
  File "ludwig/data/preprocessing.py", line 1359, in build_data
    get_from_registry(feature_config[TYPE], get_base_type_registry()).add_feature_data(
  File "ludwig/features/vector_feature.py", line 123, in add_feature_data
    raise ValueError(
ValueError: The user provided value for vector size ({'vector_size': None, 'missing_value_strategy': 'drop_row', 'fill_value': '', 'computed_fill_value': ''}) does not match the value observed in the data: 10
```

So we should be able to just treat `None` as "infer this for the user" and set 10 automatically.
